problems.title: Polynomial Addition using Linked List
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given two polynomials represented using a linked list. Each node contains two values: coefficient (coeff) and exponent (pow). The terms are sorted in descending order based on the exponent. Your task is to add the two polynomials and return the resulting polynomial. If coefficients become zero after addition, skip that term. If the resulting polynomial has no terms, print 0.

Time Complexity
The polynomial addition requires traversing both lists once, hence O(N + M).

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (number of terms in polynomial 1).
The next N lines contain two integers: coefficient and exponent.
The following line contains an integer M (number of terms in polynomial 2).
The next M lines contain two integers: coefficient and exponent.

Output Format
Print the resulting polynomial in the format coeffx^pow separated by a space. If empty, print 0.

Example
Input:
3
5 2
4 1
2 0
3
5 1
5 0
3 3
Output:
3x^3 5x^2 9x^1 7x^0
problems.constraints:
0 ≤ N, M ≤ 100000
Coefficients may be positive or negative
Exponents are non-negative and sorted in decreasing order
Expected Time Complexity: O(N + M)
hintsList: Use merge-like traversal on the two polynomial lists.
If exponents match, sum coefficients and skip if zero.

problems.title: Detect Loop in Linked List
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given N integers to create a Singly Linked List (SLL) by inserting elements at the end. After building the list, you are given an integer P. If P > 0, connect the last node to the P-th node (1-based index) to form a loop. Your task is to detect if a loop exists in the linked list.
Print YES if a loop is present, otherwise print NO.

Time Complexity
Floyd's Cycle Detection algorithm works in O(N) time with O(1) extra space.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers.
The third line contains an integer P.

Output Format
Print YES if linked list contains a loop, otherwise print NO.

Example
Input:
5
1 2 3 4 5
3
Output:
YES
problems.constraints:
0 ≤ N ≤ 100000
Values may be positive or negative
1 ≤ P ≤ N (if P > 0)
Expected Time Complexity: O(N)
hintsList: If slow == fast at any point, loop exists.

problems.title: Remove Loop from Linked List
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given N integers to create a Singly Linked List (SLL) by inserting elements at the end. After building the list, an integer P is given. If P > 0, connect the last node to the P-th node (1-based index) to form a loop. Your task is to remove the loop if it exists, and then print the updated linked list in normal linear format. If the list is empty, print -1.

Time Complexity
Loop removal using Floyd's algorithm runs in O(N) time with O(1) extra space.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers.
The third line contains an integer P.

Output Format
Print the linked list elements separated by space. If list is empty, print -1.

Example
Input:
5
1 2 3 4 5
3
Output:
1 2 3 4 5
problems.constraints:
0 ≤ N ≤ 100000
Values may be positive or negative
1 ≤ P ≤ N (if P > 0)
Expected Time Complexity: O(N)
hintsList: Use Floyd's Cycle Detection to find meeting point.
Move one pointer to head and step both one-by-one until next of both meet.

problems.title: Merge Two Sorted Linked Lists
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given two sorted Singly Linked Lists (SLL). Your task is to merge them into a single sorted linked list and print the result. Both lists are sorted in non-decreasing order. Merge the lists by rearranging existing nodes and return the final merged list. If both lists are empty, print -1.

Time Complexity
The merge operation traverses both lists once, hence O(N + M).

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers (sorted List 1).
The third line contains an integer M.
The fourth line contains M space-separated integers (sorted List 2).

Output Format
Print the merged sorted linked list elements separated by space. If list is empty, print -1.

Example
Input:
3
1 3 5
3
2 4 6
Output:
1 2 3 4 5 6
problems.constraints:
0 ≤ N, M ≤ 100000
Values may be positive or negative
Expected Time Complexity: O(N + M)
hintsList: Use two pointers technique, compare values, and attach the smaller one.
Continue appending remaining nodes from non-empty list.

problems.title: Check if Linked List is Palindrome
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given N integers to create a Singly Linked List (SLL) by inserting elements at the end. Your task is to check whether the linked list represents a palindrome sequence or not. Print YES if the linked list is a palindrome, otherwise print NO.

Time Complexity
Checking palindrome using the fast and slow pointer approach and reversing second half runs in O(N) time and O(1) extra space.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print YES if the linked list is palindrome, otherwise print NO.

Example
Input:
5
1 2 3 2 1
Output:
YES
problems.constraints:
0 ≤ N ≤ 100000
Values may be positive or negative
Expected Time Complexity: O(N)
